item.title: #en @ 1510796170066493443
item.description: Great news to share! @OpenSpecy and @MoorePlasticRes just got funded for the next two years to develop #OpenSource software for #microplastics research and #OpenData. Looking forward to sharing more about these projects soon.

item.title: #en @ 1509893748636925954
item.description:
An aside: This story is a triumph of open data.
For years, the city has put out a database of collisions causing death or serious injury â€” a resource of around 17,000 records, but really not enough of a sample for such a citywide analysis.
This is 500,000.
*That* is a sample.

item.title: #en @ 1509858163750850573
item.description: We make some recommendations: Psych Science should require a reproducibility check at the peer review stage before awarding badges, and the badge could be renamed â€œOpen Data and Codeâ€ to avoid confusion and encourage researchers to adhere to this higher standard. |13

item.title: #en @ 1509858139071565852
item.description: Itâ€™s really important to note that our goal was *not* to critique the individual papers or authors, but rather to examine the overall effectiveness of the Open Data badge policy at Psychological Science in achieving its aims. |5

item.title: #en @ 1509858135007191043
item.description: So we did just that! Here is a preprint of our study in which we look at whether the Open Data badge policy lives up to its ideal of ensuring reproducibility: https://t.co/QaiO6wy2mG |3

item.title: #en @ 1509858132369027074

item.title: #en @ 1509593391096635395
item.description: DPGs are open-source software, open data, open AI models, open standards, and open content that adhere to privacy and other applicable best practices, following do no harm by design. These unlock the potential of digital transformation while protecting against many of the risks.
